comments.body: Absolutely. My family cannot afford a game pass either. Can you do something about this?

I don't think you really have access to all those files on a phone. On a computer, you can get the files and move them. On a phone, they're probably considered internal files, being inaccessible.

For these reasons, yes, it could be a nice idea. I don't know about the feasibility of it, it might be hard to actually make.

I also think that it would be super cool if we could give the cats a personality and they act as their given personality.
Finally I think that you should add something were we have the choice to give the cats a scenaario and they talk, move, act, and react as a human would to their given scenaario.

For all the functionality they are adding to Bedrock Add-ons, Java Edition *lacks* this ability to add in new entities, and I'm not clear why Add-ons are not a given in Java. Pretty much the same as why I'm not clear why Data Packs are not on Bedrock, given how useful each is to the one platform they are on.

Perhaps I have the solution to your problems: addon transfer from your phone or tablet. Essentially, When an addon pack Is downloaded, and you then go onto the Xbox edition, You can check An “addon account storage” which houses addons In a similar format to how you add resource and behavior packs In your account. You could get the addons by downloading them from the account storage.

Renaldo, the problem to your solution is the requirement of another minecraft premium licence. Also, it's a bit anoying to transfer them via this method because i'ce heard that you need realms in order to achieve this goal.

this won't happen for pretty obvious reasons Nintendo and Sony will never allow user generated content that isn't checked by Sony/Nintendo moderators. Nintendo has never and will never allow unchecked user generated content (like addons) of any kind on their games or platforms they have been very up front about this from day 1 and Sony is really REALLY sticked about what kind of user generated content is allowed on their platform look at fallout 4 for example fallout 4 has modding support on consoles and it allows for custom textures, modeling and properties for the Xbox version but on the PlayStation version its doesn't allow for any of that. In all it just won't happen because Sony and Nintendo are too scared that someone may find a way to hack into their consoles through Minecraft addons

I have like 20 addons active right now and it changes alot but each one changes it one by one not all of it. Like colorful containers changes the ui for all things that have a open ui like chests, crafting tables, etc. One addon let's me put the whole gui in dark mode But that's it nothing else. Small tweaks that can change just little bit to make it for fun but not change the whole game. Have a single addon on marketplace would allow people to customize there experience little by little.

It's been six years since Better Together and it still feels like no one cares for Bedrock over there.

One possible solution could be to utilize the Steam Workshop, which has been successful in hosting mods and add-ons for other games. However, the challenge would be integrating the add-ons with Minecraft. Perhaps there could be a feature in the game that allows players to browse and download add-ons directly from the Workshop, and the game could automatically install them in the appropriate folder. It would certainly make it easier for players to find and download add-ons without having to worry about sketchy download sites or adfly links.

Yea Microsoft and Mojang need to put more effort into this part of the game. Like the implementation of Addons is going well according to the changelogs, but there's little effort in the community of it. An accessible place for sharing/downloading addons would be a necessary step in this effort.
They already have the marketplace, if they were to make an official site, it would make no difference.

I don't want java to become like bedrock. Having freedom in java edition is great but having to pay for mods would ruin the experience. Also, if you're going to say "ThEY CoUlD be FrEe ThOUgh", first realise how much money mojang makes out of selling useless mods on bedrock.

I'm also here! It's also strange to me why Microsoft didn't offer an alternative for downloading addons. So now I use MCPEDL and ModBay. But lately I prefer to use more https://modbay.org/ because addons, maps and resource packs are pre-moderated and there is content that is not on MCPEDL. Any other ideas?

This is unquestionably something we need! Given that the marketplace is a crucial part of Minecraft Bedrock, this would definitely add a whole new level of depth to the content that creators produce. The reason the votes are so low for this is because:

1. This is bedrock, and the word doesn't get out as well for this platform.

2. Many of the votes out there for the affirmation of this are creators.

3. People don't realize how GAME CHANGING this would be.

Let's get the word out there, people!

While some Biomes should get the four Seasons; Spring, Summer, Autumn, and winter; most should instead get two; the longer Wet Season & longer Dry Season.  There should be less rain in the summer, but a bit higher chance of thunderstorms when it does rain in Biomes experiencing the Summer Season. Trees should yield more apples in the summer and fall, but none in the winter.

The plains, river, mountain, and Swap biome should be coded to be able to generate with either 2 or 4 seasons. However the Mangrove Swamp should never have 4 Seasons, and the regular Swamp Biome should have a decreased chance of having 4 Seasons.  Most, or perhaps all, naturally Generated Oak & Birch forest Biomes definably should be able to experience the Autumn Season, as these would be most likely to benefit. 

Perhaps when starting a new map, spawn should always be either in the Spring or mid-Wet Season. The wet & dry Seasons should be twice as long as the other 4 seasons.

Perhaps, all chunks that have been loaded prior to the seasonal update, should have only the wet & dry season.
I would prefer seasonal biomes. They're static and cannot alter anything in the world, including players' builds and farms, as well as providing permanent blocks for themed builds.
*in angry gordon ramsay voice* the minecraft lacks SEASONING!

Minecraft likes to keep game play simple so they probably won't get rid of water sources with extreme heat, there should be biomes that don't have seasons change, like the dessert biome would normally be quite hot so rain there is very rare. the plains biome, coastal village, oak forest, and birch forest should have snow sometime in the gameplay. Places like the snowy biomes, cold beaches and anywhere where there is usually snow year round should have times where snow will melt but not all of it will melt away. Different biomes would have different times for each season that way. Jungle biomes have a more tropical feel to them and they don't seem to have much rain like most tropical places do, I would recommend having more rain in that biome. That's all I have to add thank your for reading if you read it all. :)
Great idea! I feel like the warmer biomes (like jungles and savannas) should have rainy and dry seasons instead.
An awesome idea.
I agree 💯% it would affect the areas where it does rain already and the snowy biomes would get blizzards only. Perhaps some dust/sand storms for desert biomes.

I would add to the update that leaf blocks could be traversed with some slowdown (similar to how it works with snow blocks). In the case of falling from a great height, you would still absorb part of the impact but wouldn't lose as many hearts.

It would be great if they included winds that could move objects and even mobs if they were very strong. Depending on the day, there would be air currents, and if storm clouds approach or if you are in a high and cold area, the wind would be more aggressive.

The last thing I would like to suggest is that clouds are generated in different layers (unlike now, where they are only generated in one layer). It would also be great if they had behaviors like slowly gathering before raining and fixing something that seemed strange to me, making the rain come out of the clouds instead of falling uniformly from the sky as it has been until now.

I love the idea, but the only thing is I don't know if the seasons should impact the world so much (like water disappearing). The would be frustrating. I think they should impact mob spawns and weather patterns. I also think they could change food/add plenty of new food sources that you would be forced to make in certain seasons. 

I love the idea of blizzards and reduced visibility. Also adding fog after weather events could be so cool!!
Ultimately, if they add this they should make it an option to turn on or off (or if you play in hard you must select it), that way old timey players don't get upset because this would change a lot of the vanilla gameplay.

Seasons are definitely a great idea. The problem I see is you load an area you haven't visited since winter, and even though it is now summer, when you arrive, the area doesn't have time to update, and everything is covered in snow. Hard to work around for devs, I believe.

Maybe with a function (using in-game time and world seed), it could be possible to calculate the state in which each blocks with sky access should be (since they're the only ones affected by seasons) before loading any chunk, but I'm really not sure about performance.

If the replay ability feature isn't fully created and shipped, perhaps because only a certain percentage of people would use it, then at least adding in the hooks that would allow the recording of things similar to what the Java Replay Mod does. That way an add on could be used by the people who want the feature and perhaps different implementations could be made for different needs.

An additional use case for this would be for players to be able to look back at an "instant replay" where they can preset how long things are recording for... say like 30 seconds or 1 minute... and while they are turning on their redstone based device... or pvp'ing, or whatever, something happens in their world they want to watch back, they can go to the instant replay of that moment, and watch back to see what happened wrong with their redstone... or get a better look at the device running, or see what killed them, or how. Many cool uses for normal players.

This would not only be good for creators. Sharing clips with friends would be right in line with the whole idea of better together. It would also be useful for players testing farms having the ability to "fly" around the farm as it is working to see where errors may be happening. There are a number of uses for this. Aside from those uses...this is pretty much a standard feature on numerous other games out in the world and really makes no sense to not have it baked into Minecraft.
NEED REPLAY FOR BEDROCK

If it's enabled it should NOT disable achievements for the player as the Replay add on should not be able to access creative mode or anything other than simply recording footage for timelapses and things of that nature. I'm so sick of every camera add on being forced to disable achievements for players.

I really hope this becomes a feature because then I can capture epic moments when playing servers or in the game. The only problem is that this will take up lots of space and performance for devices like mobile, Xbox, or Nintendo which have already been suffering from a lot of problems. But I'm all for this idea of having Bedrock capable replay. It would be awesome and it would also be great if Java could also have replaying capabilities without mods. But Bedrock first of course!

Having replay for Bedrock would be a huge advantage for content creators. This will enable the Bedrock content creators the ability to put out better quality videos and might encourage some Java content creators to release some cross-platform videos.

You can alraady do that via NBT editing, you can use NBT Studio and edit string tag called "FlatWorldLayers" following this syntax:
{

"biome_id":1,

"block_layers":[

    {"block_data":0,"block_id":7,"count":1},

    {"block_data":0,"block_id":3,"count":2},

    {"block_data":0,"block_id":2,"count":1}

  ],

"encoding_version":3,

"structure_options":null

}
